Since President Trump was elected into office, NATO has gone from 3 to 9 countries who are spending 2% or more of their GDP on defense, amounting to an additional $130B. More countries will do so in the next few years. This burden of defense sharing is a victory for @POTUS.

As we kick off a new week, all we hear from Pelosi, Schiff, and Nader is more impeachment plans. We hear crickets about a budget, an overdue defense authorization and a #USMCA vote. America’s top issues are being overlooked. We need to get these priorities done now.
